instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> restarting
threads.message:
hello got <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> can on but suddenly restart itself after entering the password then hangs apple logo with loading bar.
tried change ssd still same try run diagnostics no issues found.
no sign of waterdamage or corrosion.
i run smc bypass no restart.
got this panic error.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> restarting
threads.message:
Disconnect internal SSD and test with USB macOS.
If still the same, clean ME region in BIOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> restarting
threads.message:
still same can u give me clean me <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
thanks!

threads.message:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> restarting
threads.message: Then may be CPU, or RAM problem.
